item.title: Pi 317
item.dc:creator: @portugalrox portugalrox
item.description:
@portugalrox wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:40, topic:542179”]Try this:
(remember, replace the entire method)

[code=java]public void playersOnline() {
int line = c.questbkIds[0];
String rank = “”;
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“Players online: " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 8144);
for (int i = 0; i < c.questbkIds.length; i++)
c.getPA().sendFrame126(”", c.questbkIds[i]);

try {
	for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) {
		if(line == 8196)
			line = 12174;
		if(line == 8146)
			line++;
		if(line > 12223)
			break;
		Client c2 = (Client) client;
		if(c2 != null){
			switch(c2.playerRights) {
				case 1:
					rank = "[Mod]";
					break;
			}
			c.getPA().sendFrame126(Misc.optimizeText(rank + c2.playerName), line);
			line++;
		}
	}
} catch (Exception e) {
}
c.getPA().showInterface(8134);

}[/code][/quote]
If I were to add admin rank now would I do it like this?
public void playersOnline() {
int line = c.questbkIds[0];
String rank = “”;
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“Players online: " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 8144);
for (int i = 0; i < c.questbkIds.length; i++)
c.getPA().sendFrame126(”", c.questbkIds[i]);

try {
	for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) {
		if(line == 8196)
			line = 12174;
		if(line == 8146)
			line++;
		if(line > 12223)
			break;
		Client c2 = (Client) client;
		if(c2 != null){
			switch(c2.playerRights) {
				case 1:
					rank = "[Mod]";
					break;
                                                                  case 2:
                                                                                rank = "[Admin]";
                                                                                break;
			}
			c.getPA().sendFrame126(Misc.optimizeText(rank + c2.playerName), line);
			line++;
		}
	}
} catch (Exception e) {
}
c.getPA().showInterface(8134);

item.title: Pi 317
item.dc:creator: @portugalrox portugalrox
item.description:
@portugalrox wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:41, topic:542179”][code=java] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“getallips”)) {
try {
String name = playerCommand.substring(10);
String ip = null;
for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) {

                        Client c2 = (Client) client;
                        if(c2 != null && client.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)){
                                ip = c2.connectedFrom;
                                break;
                        }

                }
                if (ip == null) {
                    c.sendMessage("Player "+name+" must not be online");
                    return /*true/false*/;
                }
                c.sendMessage("All players connected from:"+ip);
                int counter = 0;
                for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) {

                        Client c2 = (Client) client;
                        if(c2 != null && c2.connectedFrom.equals(ip)) {
                                c.sendMessage(++counter+":"+c2.playerName);
                                break;
                        }

                }
        } catch (Exception e) {
                c.sendMessage("Error during parse.");
        }
}[/code][/quote]

THANKS!

Also Sk8r it worked! Now do I add all ranks onto this code or should I make individuals?

Read full topic

item.title: Pi 317
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s because on your last edit you seem to have removed the line++ at the end of the loop.
try this:

public void playersOnline() { int line = c.questbkIds[0]; String rank = ""; c.getPA().sendFrame126("Players online: " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 8144); for (int i = 0; i < c.questbkIds.length; i++) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("", c.questbkIds[i]); } try { for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) { if(line == 8196) line = 12174; if(line == 8146) line++; if(line > 12223) break; Client c2 = (Client) client; if(c2 != null){ c.getPA().sendFrame126(Misc.optimizeText(rank + c2.playerName), line); line++; } switch(c2.playerRights) { case 1: rank = "[Mod]"; break; } line++; } } catch (Exception e) { } c.getPA().showInterface(8134); }

Read full topic

item.title: Pi 317
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“portugalrox, post:33, topic:542179”]Sorry to make this on-going… But where you told me to add “Players online” actually added it in the names of players online column and not the top left title. :S

Also if you still feel like helping me out one cent more if not its okay, how can I show [owner] [admin] [mod] and [donator] beside names I’m sure if I just saw one I could create them all. <3[/quote]
Hm.
Try adding this perhaps:

c.getPA().sendFrame126("Players online: " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 8144);

Adding ranks in front of the names is easy.
Under the for loop where all the if(line) statements are we’re going to add a switch statement.
Above the loop we’re going to add a String.

	// This goes in the loop
	switch(c2.playerRights) {
		case 1:
			rank = "[Mod]";
			break;
	}
	String rank = "";// This goes above

I’ve given you an example for the player rights of 1 in the switch.

Now we’re going to replace:

Misc.optimizeText(c2.playerName)
with:

Misc.optimizeText(rank + c2.playerName)

Read full topic

        for (int i = 0; i < c.questbkIds.length; i++) {

item.title: Pi 317
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“portugalrox, post:27, topic:542179”]You know, you seem like a nice guy I don’t see why some people wouldn’t like you… This isn’t the first time you’ve helped me in the help section and I see you help others. You’re also very active. Not sure what requirements on here are for staff but you seem like a good prospect. also how do I know if it’s working? Do I test by doing ::players or ? Sorry I won’t do anything until you tell me.

Thanks for your help.[/quote]
We haven’t added the actual command, so doing ::players wouldn’t do anything.

public int[] questbkIds = { 8145, 8147, 8148, 8149, 8150, 8151, 8152, 8153, 8154, 8155, 8156, 8157, 8158, 8159, 8160, 8161, 8162, 8163, 8164, 8165, 8166, 8167, 8168, 8169, 8170, 8171, 8172, 8173, 8174, 8175, 8176, 8177, 8178, 8179, 8180, 8181, 8182, 8183, 8184, 8185, 8186, 8187, 8188, 8189, 8190, 8191, 8192, 8193, 8194, 8195, 12174, 12175, 12176, 12177, 12178, 12179, 12180, 12181, 12182, 12183, 12184, 12185, 12186, 12187, 12188, 12189, 12190, 12191, 12192, 12193, 12194, 12195, 12196, 12197, 12198, 12199, 12200, 12201, 12202, 12203, 12204, 12205, 12206, 12207, 12208, 12209, 12210, 12211, 12212, 12213, 12214, 12215, 12216, 12217, 12218, 12219, 12220, 12221, 12222, 12223 };
There’s an array of all the quest list ID’s I believe.
Place it in Player.java, as it can be used in various areas (I’ve used something similar to this).
Now, at the top of the method we created, you want to add:

for (int i = 0; i < c.questbkIds.length; i++) { c.getPA().questbkIds("", c.questbkIds[i]); }
This will make all the lines blank (removing that qjXXX crap).

Now it’s time to add all the players onto the interface.

It’s time for us to edit that loop we took from your kick command.

Note: I just changed the idea in my head, so it may not be the most OO (Object Oriented) code, but it gets the job done I think.

We’re going to add a variable to the top of the method, this is going to tell us what line we’re on.

int line = c.questbkIds[0];

Okay, you’re going to want to replace the for loop (The Player client : PlayerHandler.players one) with this:

		for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) {
			if(line == 8196)
				line = 12174;
			if(line == 8146)
				line++;
			if(line > 12223)
				break;
			Client c2 = (Client) client;
			if(c2 != null){
				c.getPA().sendFrame126(Misc.optimizeText(c2.playerName), line);
				line++;
			}
		}

An explanation:

if(line == 8196) line = 12174;
This will change the line number to 12174 when if the line number is at 8196. Since 8195 is the last id for the 8100’s, and the loop adds 1 after the string is sent to the client, I put all the checks for the int ‘line’ before the string is sent.

if(line == 8146) line++;
For some reason, the interface id 8146 isn’t used on the interface. It’s skipped. So you want to skip it here as well. (that’s what the code does lol)

if(line > 12223) break;
Line 12223 is the last line in the interface, so if we get past that line the loop will be broken with the “break;” (aka it will be stopped).

Now, on to the command (I hope I didn’t miss anything above )
This command is going to look 300x simpler now that we put all that code into a method.

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) { c.getPA().playersOnline(); }

That should be everything. If something isn’t working correctly or you got errors you know the drill
The final code:

public void playersOnline() { int line = c.questbkIds[0]; for (int i = 0; i < c.questbkIds.length; i++) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("", c.questbkIds[i]); } try { for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) { if(line == 8196) line = 12174; if(line == 8146) line++; if(line > 12223) break; Client c2 = (Client) client; if(c2 != null){ c.getPA().sendFrame126(Misc.optimizeText(c2.playerName), line); line++; } } } catch (Exception e) { } c.getPA().showInterface(8134); }

Read full topic
